data.title: Oklahoma State University
data.text:
Driskill Warner Family Endowment

The recipient(s) must be enrolled as a full-time student at the University in the College of Arts and Sciences and must have a University grade point average of at least 3.8 on a 4.0 scale. The recipient must have exhibited academic performance that reflects a high likelihood of successfully achieving his/her bachelorâ€™s degree, in the discretion of the selection committee. Recipient should also be recognized by their instructors as exemplifying exceptional attitude, work ethic, and promise. Selection preference will be given to students majoring in mathematics, philosophy and the foreign languages. The scholarship is not available to incoming freshmen students.

Fourjay Foundation Annual Scholarship

The focus of general scholarships funded through the foundation and awarded by the financial aid office are for students in financial crisis who have exhausted other means of federal aid and scholarships but who still need additional assistance to remain in school, middle-income students whose family income is too high to qualify for grants but not high enough that their family can afford college without borrowing heavily, and students for whom the OSU Office of Scholarships and Financial Aid performs dependency overrides for federal aid (they don't qualify for parent loans/aid). Because Mr. Jackson was committed to helping students find their career path and complete college, the College of Arts and Sciences proposes that the $25,000 gift from the Fourjay Foundation be used for undeclared majors who enroll through the College of Arts and Sciences.

Gabriel Endowed Scholarship

The recipients must be enrolled as full-time students at Oklahoma State University and may be classified at either the undergraduate or graduate level. All recipients must show evidence of financial need, exhibit strong leadership ability as well as good character, and demonstrate high academic achievement. Two equal awards will be distributed from the Gabriel Endowed Scholarship Fund. One recipient will be selected from the instrumental music department based on the student's instrumental ability and the needs of the department to attract particular instrumentation; one recipient will be selected from the history department based on competitive proposals from the students.

Anne Clark McHale Scholarship

The recipients must be a female student enrolled full-time at Oklahoma State University in the College of Arts and Sciences who is completing her junior year with a 3.2 or better grade point average. The recipient must be majoring in chemistry, physics, mathematics, or microbiology. If two or more students have equal qualifications, preference will be given to the one showing greatest financial need. If at any time no suitable candidate is available in any of these fields, the award will be allowed to accumulate and the accumulated sum will be awarded to the next eligible candidate.

Joan Marie Tippeconnie Endowed Scholarship

The recipient must be enrolled as a full-time student at the University and must be majoring in the pre-medicine discipline. The recipient must have a grade point average of at least 2.8 on a 4.0 scale and have documented financial need. Recipients must be students who are enrolled members of a federally recognized American Indian tribe.

A & S Dean's Staff Scholarship

The recipient may be enrolled as a full-time or part-time student at Oklahoma State University. Incoming freshmen, continuing or transfer students may be eligible for the award, provided they are in good standing with the University and have maintained a 3.0 grade point average. The scholarship may be continued for up to three years pending committee approval. Preference shall be given to a child of a current or past Dean's staff member. In the event there are no suitable applicants, the award may be made to a current member of the Dean's staff. The scholarship may or may not be awarded each year.

Rohrberger Endowment

Scholarships for A & S students.

Bellmon Internship Endowment

Applicants must be enrolled as full-time undergraduate students at Oklahoma State University and scheduled to complete internships at the state or national levels of government. Applicants must have completed at l east 12 hours at OSU prior to application, and preference will be given to upperclassmen. Students will be selected based on their academic record, campus involvement an demonstration of character, values and work ethic as illustrated through a written essay and letters of recommendation.

Fourjay Foundation Scholarship

The recipient must be a full-time student enrolled in the College of Arts and Sciences at Oklahoma State University. Preference will be given to those (a) who have demonstrated high career potential and (b) show financial need.

Native American Studies Award

Determined by the selection committee.

George A. and Mary Lou Gries Endowed Scholarship Fund

Recipients must be enrolled as full-time students at Oklahoma State University in the College of Arts and Sciences. Recipients shall have at least a 3.5 grade point average.

Arts and Sciences Alumni Scholarship Account

Determined by the selection committee.

Going Scholarship

Needy and deserving pre-medical students in his or her third or fourth year at OSU.

Rector Scholarship

The recipient of this honor shall be deserving male students at the Oklahoma State University who are intending to go to medical school after completion of their pre-medical studies.

Scales Memorial Scholarship

Outstanding sophomore in Arts and Sciences.
